This course has reserved seats for BMUS students. 

For non-BMUS students:
MUSC 100 is open to students in other departments and faculties, without pre-requisites.

MUSC 100 is a required course in the Major and Minor in Music.

If you're interested in the course, please register directly in the course, or if there are no seats remaining, join the waitlist.

Students with a declared Major or Minor in Music will have priority for registration from the waitlist.


Note that some lecture and discussion sections must be registered together:
MUSC 100 001 - students in this lecture section must register in either D01, D02, or D03

MUSC 100 002 - students in this lecture section must register in either D04 or D05

Section 002 for students who are not in the Major in Composition.Interested students should contact Dr. Jennifer Butler (jennifer.butler@ubc.ca) and submit one or two representative scores for permission to register. Two years of university-level theory are recommended, but not required.

Course Section: MUSC_V 108-001 - Introduction to Contemporary Art Music
Course Section Definition Public Notes: An introductory repertoire course for composers. This course focuses on compositional issues and approaches in art music of the past fifty years. Coursework includes listening, score study, readings, quizzes and in-class presentations. Restricted to undergraduate composition majors; other BMus students may register by permission of the instructor.
For BMUS GSEM and BMUS GSSM majors only.
This course is for BMUS students as well as other students interested in the BA Major or Minor in Music. Must read music.

For BMUS GSEM and BMUS GSSM majors only. Term 1: Clarinet and saxophone on Monday and Wednesday, Flute on Friday; Term 2: Oboe and Bassoon Monday and Wednesday, Flute on Friday. Course Coordinator: Julia Nolan

Each week, students study online course materials on their own time (asynchronously), attend the in-person lecture on Tuesdays from 8:30-9:20 am, and attend the in-person 50-minute discussion for which they have registered on Mondays at either 11am, 1 pm, or 2 pm. This class is one option that can satisfy the BMUS World Music requirement.
Restricted to BMUS Education Stream students (GSEM; GSSM) only. Very limited enrolment; contact instructor for permission to register.
With MUSC 235. Restricted to BMUS OPER, or DMPS. Open to other students by permission of the instructor.
For BMUS students only.
For BMUS students only.

Large Instrumental Ensemble - UBC Concert WindsOpen only to 1st and 2nd year undergraduate students (see MUSC 350C for 3rd and 4th year registration; 550C for graduate registration).Open to non-music majors and secondary concentrators who are performers on woodwinds, brass, or percussion. Open to other students by audition, with credit, as stipulated by their faculties. May be repeated for credit. The ensemble rehearses MW 6-8:00 and makes four performances each year, with the majority of rehearsals and concerts taking place in the Chan Centre. While every effort is made to place students in appropriate ensembles based upon audition results, those taking this course as an elective are advised to have an alternate course ready in the unlikely case where an ensemble placement is not available. Entrance by audition each September. For more info: http://music.ubc.ca/student-ensembles

For 1st and 2nd year undergraduates (see MUSC 453A for 3rd and 4th year registration; 553A for graduate registration).OPEN TO NON-MUSIC STUDENTS: How do I register for ensembles? For most ensembles an audition is required to secure your place. During the audition you play or sing a prepared piece for the conductor. Auditions for ensembles take place at the beginning of each academic year. http://music.ubc.ca/student-ensemblesStudents who wish to be notified when the audition details are updated should ensure they are on the waitlist.
